classes.description: The Interventions class includes CDASH domains that define collection standards for investigational treatments, therapeutic treatments, and procedures that are intentionally administered to the subject either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDASHIG v2.0, Section 8.1)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What is the subject identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for Concomitant Medication
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CMCAT
fields.questionText: What is the category for the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the CMCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer.
fields.label: Subcategory for Concomitant Medication
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CMSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the subcategory for the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject took any (concomitant) [medications/treatments]. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not any (concomitant) medications/treatments/therapies were taken/given.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
fields.label: Any Concomitant Medications Taken
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: CMYN
fields.questionText: Were any (concomitant) [medication(s)/treatment(s)/therap(ies)] taken?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMSPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier which can be used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: Since SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile concomitant medication/treatment records with AEs and/or Medical History. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: CMSPID
fields.questionText: What is the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMTRT

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reported Name of Drug, Med, or Therapy

fields.completionInstructions: Record only one [medication/treatment/therapy] per line. Provide the full trade or proprietary name of the [medication/treatment/therapy]; otherwise the generic name may be recorded.
fields.definition: Verbatim medication name or treatments (include only treatments with data collection characteristics similar to medications).
fields.implementationNotes: In most cases, the verbatim drug names or treatment will be coded to a standard dictionary such as WHO DRUG after the data have been collected on the CRF. For the collection of verbatim drug name or treatments , the recommendation is to ask the sites to provide the full trade or proprietary name since it is more exact than the generic. The full trade name provides the base generic and the appropriate salt for that particular drug. In addition, for coding purposes it helps with ATC selection. For example, Tylenol with codeine #1 has a different ATC code from Tylenol with codeine #3. This field can be used for either prior or concomitant medication/treatments.
fields.label: Concomitant Medication Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CMTRT
fields.questionText: What was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] (name/term)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMOCCUR

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if [specific medication/treatment] was taken by checking Yes or No.
fields.definition: An indication whether the pre-specified medication/treatment/therapy (CMTRT) or the group of medications/treatments/therapies was administered when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention is solicited.
fields.implementationNotes: CMOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of a pre-specific medication/treatment. CMOCCUR is not used for spontaneously free text reported concomitant medication/treatments. The site should be able to indicate that the response was not asked or answered.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Occurrence
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". If the response was not asked or answered, populate the SDTMIG variable CMSTAT with "NOT DONE".
fields.name: CMOCCUR
fields.questionText: Did the subject take [pre-specified (concomitant) medication/treatment/therapy/dose]?; Has the subject taken [pre-specified (concomitant) medication/treatment/therapy/dose]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMINGRD

fields.completionInstructions: Prior to a subject's clinical visit, remind all subjects to bring all medications bottles, packs etc. they are taking with them to their clinical visit. Record all active ingredient(s) off the medication label and separate each ingredient with a comma for the name of drug medication or treatment taken. For example, the medication Dolmen, if manufactured in Spain, the active ingredients should be collected as noted below: Active Ingredient: Acetylsalicylic Acid, Ascorbic acid, codeine phosphate.
fields.definition: Medication Ingredients.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be collected in addition to the Medication/Treatment Name. Collecting this provides more detailed information when coding to a medication dictionary like WHO Drug Enhanced format C which now codes to the ingredient level for many trade named medications. For example, the medication Dolmen, depending on the country where it is manufactured, the active ingredients may be different. Spain: Acetylsalicylic Acid, Ascorbic acid, codeine phosphate Italy and Czech Republic: contains Tenoxicam Estonia and Latvia: contains Dexketoprofen trometamol.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Active Ingredients
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: CMINGRD
fields.questionText: What were the active ingredients?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMINDC

fields.completionInstructions: Record the reason the medication was taken based on clinical investigator's evaluation. If taken to treat a condition, and a diagnosis was made, the indication should be the diagnosis. If taken to treat a condition, and no diagnosis was made, the indication should be the signs and symptoms. If taken as prophylaxis, report as "Prophylaxis for " and include a description of the condition(s).
fields.definition: The condition, disease, symptom or disorder that the concomitant (non-study) medication/treatment/therapy was used to address or investigate (e.g., why the medication/treatment/therapy was taken or administered).
fields.implementationNotes: This is not the pharmacological/therapeutic classification of an agent (e.g., antibiotic, analgesic, etc.), but the reason for its administration to the subject. This additional information is collected on the CRF when the sponsor would want to capture the reason(s) why a subject took a medication/treatment. This information can then be used as deemed appropriate for coding, analysis (i.e., in the classification of medications), for reconciling the medications/treatments taken by a subject with their provided medical history and/or AEs/SAEs as part of the data clean-up and monitoring process, etc.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Indication
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CMINDC
fields.questionText: For what indication, was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] taken?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMAENO

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier of the Adverse Event for which this (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] was taken.
fields.definition: Identifier for the adverse event that is the indication for this medication/treatment/therapy.
fields.implementationNotes: Intent is to establish a link between the medication/treatment and the AE that was reported. CMAENO can be used to identify a relationship between records in CM dataset and records in the AE dataset. See section 8.2 in the SDTMIG V3.2 for information on RELREC.
fields.label: Related Adverse Event ID
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the Adverse Events domain.
fields.name: CMAENO
fields.questionText: What was the identifier for the adverse event(s) for which the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] was taken?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMMHNO

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier of the medical history event for which this (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] was taken.
fields.definition: Identifier for the medical history condition that is the indication for this medication/treatment/therapy.
fields.implementationNotes: Intent is to establish a link between the medical history condition and the medication/treatment taken for the medical history condition. CMMHNO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the CM dataset and records in the MH dataset. See section 8.2 in the SDTMIG V3.2 for information on RELREC.
fields.label: Related Medical History Event ID
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the Medical History domain.
fields.name: CMMHNO
fields.questionText: What was the identifier for the medical history event(s) for which the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] was taken?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMDOSE

fields.completionInstructions: Record the dose of (concomitant) [medication/treatment] taken per administration (e.g., 200).
fields.definition: The dose of medication/treatment (e.g. --TRT ) given at one time represented as a numeric value.
fields.implementationNotes: Used when the dose/amount taken/administered/consumed has only numeric entries. If non-numeric entries are possible, use the CDASH field CMDSTXT.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Dose
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CMDOSE
fields.questionText: What was the individual dose (of the concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] per administration)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMDSTXT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the dose of (concomitant) [medication/treatment] taken per administration (e.g., 200).
fields.definition: The dose of medication/treatment taken per administration.
fields.implementationNotes: Defining this data collection field as a dose text field allows for flexibility in capturing dose entries as numbers, text or ranges. The data collected in this dose text-format field should be separated or mapped to either SDTMIG CMDOSE if numeric or CMDOSTXT if text.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Dose Description
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to CMDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200-400) map to CMDOSTXT in SDTM.
fields.name: CMDSTXT
fields.questionText: What was the individual dose of the (concomitant) [mediation/treatment/therapy]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMDOSTOT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the total dose of (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] taken daily.
fields.definition: The total amount of CMTRT taken over a day using the units in CMDOSU.
fields.implementationNotes: For use when only total daily dose is collected in the CRF. For general medications/treatments, it is not recommended to use Total Daily Dose. Instead, this can be calculated from other fields such as Units, Dose, and Frequency.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Total Daily Dose
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CMDOSTOT
fields.questionText: What was the total daily dose of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78417

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMDOSU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the dose unit of the dose of concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] taken (e.g., mg.).
fields.definition: The unit associated with the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy taken (e.g., mg in "2mg three times per day").
fields.implementationNotes: When sponsors collect data for amount of dose taken (i.e., Dose, Total Daily Dose), Unit must be collected as well (if applicable).
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Dose Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CMDOSU
fields.questionText: What is the unit (for the dose of concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66726
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78418

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMDOSFRM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the pharmaceutical dosage form (e.g., TABLET CAPSULE, SYRUP) of delivery for the concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] taken.
fields.definition: The pharmaceutical dosage form in which the CMTRT is physically presented.
fields.implementationNotes: Some drugs have multiple forms and this field may be needed to code the drug to an ATC level. However, in general, this level of detail should not be necessary except for medications/treatments of interest.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Dose Form
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CMDOSFRM
fields.questionText: What was the dose form of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71113
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78419

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMDOSFRQ

self.title: Concomitant Meds Dosing Frequency per Interval

fields.completionInstructions: Record how often the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] was taken (e.g., BID, PRN).
fields.definition: The number of doses given/administered/taken during a specific interval.
fields.implementationNotes: The frequency of the concomitant medication/treatment. When collected, the recommendation is to collect dosing information in separate fields (e.g., CMDOSE, CMDOSEU, CMDOSFRQ) for specific and consistent data collection and to enable programmatically utilizing these data.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Dosing Frequency per Interval
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CMDOSFRQ
fields.questionText: What was the frequency of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66729
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78420

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMROUTE

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the route of administration for the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy].
fields.definition: The route of administration of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy].
fields.implementationNotes: This additional information may be important to collect on the CRF when the sponsor would want to capture a medication's/treatment's route of administration for purposes such as coding and the medication/treatment may have more than one route. Some companies may use route in coding medications/treatments to be able to choose a precise preferred name and ATC code.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Route of Administration
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CMROUTE
fields.questionText: What was the route of administration of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMSTDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date the concomitant [medication/treatment] was first taken using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the subject has been taking the concomitant [medication/treatment] for a considerable amount of time prior to the start of the study, it is acceptable to have an incomplete date. Concomitant [medication/treatment] taken during the study are expected to have a complete start date. Prior concomitant [medication/treatment] that are exclusionary should have both a start and end date.
fields.definition: The start date when the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy was first taken represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The assumption is that sponsors should either have a Start Date or will indicate that the medication or therapy was started before, during or after the study period. The preferred method is to collect a complete Start Date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only) for medications/treatment started a considerable amount of time prior to the start of study are acceptable.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CMSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CMSTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy/dose] start date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMSTTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the concomitant [medication/treatment] was started.
fields.definition: The time the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy was started represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Recommend collecting the time a concomitant medication/treatment was started only when a protocol or data collection scenarios supports it. Typically, a start time is not collected unless the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time a concomitant medication/treatment administered or the subject records the start time in a diary. See CDASHIG Section 3.7 Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions and SDTMIG IG 3.2 section 4.1.4.7 for more information.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds Start Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CMSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CMSTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy/dose] start time?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMPRIOR

fields.completionInstructions: Check if the concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] was started before the study.
fields.definition: Indication the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy was given or taken prior to [CMSTTPT] or prior to the date in DM.RFSTDTC.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsors may collect this information rather than start dates. See CDASHIG Section 3.7 Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions and SDTMIG IG 3.2 section 4.1.4.7 for more information. Sponsors may collect this information rather than start dates.
fields.label: Prior Concomitant Meds
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as CMSTRF or CMSTRTPT. When populating CMSTRF, or CMSTRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field CMPRIOR is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When CMPRIOR refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTM variable CMSTRF should be populated. When CMPRIOR is compared to any other time point, the SDTM variables CMSTRTPT and CMSTTPT should be used. Note: CMSTRTPT must refer to the time point anchor described in CMSTTPT.
fields.name: CMPRIOR
fields.questionText: Was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] given/taken prior to [CMSTTPT]?; Was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] given/taken prior to study start?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMONGO

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Record the concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] as ongoing if the subject has not stopped taking the concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] at the time of data collection and the end date should be left blank.
fields.definition: Indication the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy is ongoing when no end date is provided.
fields.implementationNotes: This box should be checked to indicate that the concomitant medication/treatment has not stopped at the time of data collection. It is expected that every recorded medication/treatment should have either an End Date or be checked as Ongoing, but not both. However, in cases where ongoing concomitant medications/treatments are not permitted, it may not be necessary to include an Ongoing field in the CRF. Reference CDASHIG Section 3.7 for more information about collecting relative date/time and see section 4.1.4 of the SDTMIG V. 3.2 for information about mapping relative times.
fields.label: Ongoing Concomitant Meds
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as CMENRF or CMENRTPT. When populating CMENRF, if the value of CMONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating CMENRTPT, if the value of CMONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When CMONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTM variable CMENRF should be populated. When CMONGO is used in conjunction with other time point, the SDTM variables CMENRTPT and CMENTPT should be used. Note: CMENRTPT must refer to a time point anchor described in CMENTPT.
fields.name: CMONGO
fields.questionText: Was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] ongoing?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMENDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date the concomitant [medication/treatment] was stopped using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the subject has not stopped taking the concomitant [medication/treatment] leave this field blank.
fields.definition: The date that the subject ended/stopped taking the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The assumption is that sponsors should either have an End Date or will indicate that the medication or therapy was ongoing at the time of collection or at the end of the study. However, in cases where the End Date can be determined from dates collected elsewhere in the CRF it is not necessary to include an End Date in the CRF. For example, if all concomitant medications/treatments are administered only once during a trial, the End Date will be the same as the Start Date.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CMENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CMENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy/dose] end date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CM.CMENTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the concomitant medication/treatment was stopped.
fields.definition: The time when the subject ended/stopped taking the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Recommend collecting the time a concomitant medication or treatment was ended only when a protocol or data collection scenarios require it or the subject records the start time in a diary. Typically, an end time is not collected unless the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time a concomitant medication/treatment is stopped.
fields.label: Concomitant Meds End Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CMENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject took any medications. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not the subject took study medication/ treatment.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. The ECYN is meant to indicate that the exposure as collected form should be completed or inserted into the case book. ECOCCUR would be used when the actual drug name is preprinted on the CRF. While these might be equivalent in a single drug study, there are differences in how they would be used in most trials. Therefore, it does not map into the SDTM variable ECOCCUR, since ECOCCUR indicates whether the subject was actually administered treatment/medication. If actual treatment data is available (ECYN = "Y"), ECOCCUR may be populated based on whether subject was actually administered treatment/medication.
fields.label: Any Study Treatment Taken
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: ECYN
fields.questionText: Were any study treatments taken?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the study treatment category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category of Treatment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: ECCAT
fields.questionText: What is the category of the study treatment?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the study treatment subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the ECCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. ECSCAT can only be used if there is an ECCAT and it must be a subcategorization of ECCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory of Treatment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: ECSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the subcategory of the study treatment?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECTRT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of study treatment.
fields.definition: Name of the intervention or treatment known to the subject and/or administrator.
fields.implementationNotes: ECTRT is the name of the intervention or treatment known to the subject and/or administrator and it is the SDTM topic variable. It is a required variable in SDTM and must have a value in CDASH or a plan to populate it in the SDTM submission datasets (i.e. collected or populated from other sources). In a masked study, if treatment is collected and known as Tablet A to the subject or administrator, then ECTRT='TABLET A'. If in a masked study the treatment is not known by a synonym and the data are to be exchanged between sponsors, partners and/or regulatory agency(s), then assign ECTRT the value of 'MASKED'.
fields.label: Treatment Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: ECTRT
fields.questionText: What was the study treatment name?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECOCCUR

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject took study treatment. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated.
fields.definition: An indication whether the study treatment was administered when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention is solicited.
fields.implementationNotes: ECOCCUR is used to indicate whether the subject was actually administered treatment/medication. ECOCCUR should not be used to indicate that the question was not asked or answered.
fields.label: Exposure Occurrence
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". Not applicable when ECMOOD is "Scheduled".
fields.name: ECOCCUR
fields.questionText: Was [study treatment/dose] administered?; Has the subject taken [study treatment/dose]?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECREASOC

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate why the study treatment was not taken.
fields.definition: An explanation of why a scheduled study treatment administration did not occur.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the study treatment was not taken may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., SUBJECT MISTAKE, SUBJECT REFUSED, etc.) or entered as free text. When --REASOC is used, --OCCUR must also be populated in the SDTM dataset with a value of "N".
fields.label: Exposure Reason for Occur Value
fields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM = "ECREASOC" and SUPPEC.QLABEL ="Reason for Occur Value". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: ECREASOC
fields.questionText: What was the reason that the study treatment was not taken?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C125923

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECMOOD

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if this record has happened or is intended to happen.
fields.definition: Mode or condition of the record specifying whether the intervention (activity) is intended to happen or has happened.
fields.implementationNotes: CDISC Controlled Terminology request for (MOOD) code list with values of "SCHEDULED" and "PERFORMED" has been submitted as of publication of SDTMIG 3.2. "SCHEDULED" is for collected subject-level intended dose records. "PERFORMED" is for collected subject-level actual dose records. "Planned" or "Scheduled" can be pre-printed as the CRF name or section header, as applicable. If collecting both the scheduled and performed dosing in the same horizontal record, the sponsor may choose to append "_SCHEDULED" to the ECDOSE/ECDOSTXT variable name to delineate the scheduled dose from the performed dose. The performed dose would just be collected with ECDOSE/ECDOSTXT and ECDOSU.
fields.label: Exposure Mood
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". When implemented ECMOOD must be populated for all records.
fields.name: ECMOOD
fields.questionText: Does this record describe scheduled study treatment or performed study treatment?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECREFID

For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed. In this situation, sponsors may need to use additional variables.
fields.label: Exposure Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: ECREFID
fields.questionText: What is the study treatment label identifier?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECSTDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start date of the study treatment administration using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The start date of study treatment, intended or actual represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: Date when constant dosing interval of the study treatment started or single administration occurred. When collecting the date for an individual dose, the word "start" may be omitted from the Question Text and Prompt. When ECMOOD is collected and ECMOOD is "SCHEDULED" then use "intended" in the question text and prompt. When ECMOOD is collected and ECMOOD is "PERFORMED" then use "actual" in the question text and prompt.
fields.label: Exposure Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable ECSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

fields.definition: The start time of study treatment represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g.,., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Recommend collecting the time a medication was started only when a protocol or data collection scenarios requires it. When collecting the time for an individual dose, the word "start" may be omitted from the Question Text and Prompt.
fields.label: Exposure Start Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable ECSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

fields.definition: The end date of study treatment represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: Date when study treatment period stopped. If start date and end date are not expected to be on the same date, the collection of the end date is required. If the study design indicates that the start and end date are on the same day, the collection of the end date is not required since it can be assigned to be equal to the start date.
fields.label: Exposure End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable ECENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

fields.definition: The end time of study treatment represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Recommend collecting the time a medication was ended when a protocol or data collection scenarios requires it. For infusions, the end time of the infusion is typically needed.
fields.label: Exposure End Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable ECENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: ECENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [intended/actual] [study treatment/dose] end time?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECDSTXT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the dose or amount of study treatment that was administered to/taken by the subject in the period recorded; from the start date/time to the end date/time inclusive.
fields.definition: The dose of study medication taken per administration.
fields.implementationNotes: Dose or amount taken for single administration of study treatment or per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from diary data, drug accountability data, protocol etc.). Care should be taken when mapping ECDSTXT. The data collected in this dose text-format field should be separated or mapped to either ECDOSE if numeric or ECDOSTXT if text.
fields.label: Exposure Dose Description
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. The data collected in this dose text-format field should be mapped to either ECDOSE if numeric or ECDOSTXT if text.
fields.name: ECDSTXT
fields.questionText: What was the dose per administration (of study treatment)?

Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78423

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECDOSU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unit of dose or amount taken per period recorded (e.g., ng, mg, mg/kg).
fields.definition: The unit for intended dose per administration for ECDOSE, ECDOSTOT, or ECDOSTXT.
fields.implementationNotes: Unit of dose or amount taken per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose unit must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., determined from protocol, randomization data). The unit should be pre-printed on the CRF or a field provided on the CRF to capture it. A CDASH Subset Controlled Terminology Codelist Name is available for dose and volume units. In blinded trials, the collected unit may be tablet, capsule, etc., since the actual unit is also blinded.
fields.label: Exposure Dose Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: ECDOSU
fields.questionText: What were the units for the dose?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECDOSFRQ

fields.completionInstructions: Record the frequency the study treatment was administered for a defined period of time (e.g., BID, QID, TID).
fields.definition: The number of doses given/administered/taken during a specific interval.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources or if there are multiple options. When possible, the options for dose/amount frequency are pre-printed on the CRF. When collected, the recommendation is to collect dosing information in separate fields (e.g., ECDOSE, ECDOSEU, ECDOSFRQ) for specific and consistent data collection and to enable programmatically utilizing these data.
fields.label: Exposure Dosing Frequency per Interval
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: ECDOSFRQ
fields.questionText: What was the frequency of study treatment dosing?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECDOSADJ

fields.completionInstructions: Select either Yes or No to indicate whether there was a change in dosing.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not the dose was adjusted.
fields.implementationNotes: Typically, the intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring as it provides a definitive response regarding any dose changes. It provides verification that the associate field on the CRF (ECADJ) was deliberately left blank. However, the sponsor may collect whether the dose was adjusted, without collecting the reason for the change. When using ECMOOD this field should not be used.
fields.label: Dose Adjusted
fields.mappingInstructions: When ECADJ is collected, does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED. When ECADJ is not collected, the sponsor may submit this variable as a SUPPQ.
fields.name: ECDOSADJ
fields.questionText: Was the dose adjusted?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECADJ

fields.completionInstructions: If there was a change in dosing, record the reason for change.
fields.definition: Description or explanation of why a dose of the study treatment is adjusted.
fields.implementationNotes: Captures reason dose was changed or modified. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (for example, adverse event, insufficient response, etc.) or entered as free text. May be used for variations from protocol-specified doses, or changes from expected doses. Used only when an adjustment is represented in EX dataset
fields.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: ECADJ
fields.questionText: What was the reason the dose was adjusted?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECITRPD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the duration of treatment interruption.
fields.definition: The duration of the treatment interruption as collected.
fields.implementationNotes: In some situations, the duration of the interruption may be calculated from the administration start and end times recorded elsewhere in the CRF.
fields.label: Exposure Interruption Duration
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM= "ECITRPD" and SUPPEC.QLABEL= "Collected Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected treatment interruption duration and the duration unit components and create ECITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: ECITRPD
fields.questionText: If the dose was interrupted, how long was the interruption?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECTPT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point of study treatment administration if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Exposure Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors ECTPTREF (text description) and ECRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables ECTPTNUM, ECELTM.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject took any medications. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not the subject took study medication/treatment.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. The EXYN variable is a cleaning or EDC convention meant to indicate that the exposure as collected form should be completed or inserted into the case book. EXOCCUR would be used when the actual drug name is preprinted on the CRF. While these might be equivalent in a single drug study, there are differences in how they would be used in most trials. Therefore, it does not map into the SDTM variable EXOCCUR, since EXOCCUR indicates whether the subject was actually administered treatment/medication. If actual treatment data is available (EXYN = "Y"), ECOCCUR may be populated based on whether subject was actually administered treatment/medication.
fields.label: Any Study Treatment Taken
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: EXYN
fields.questionText: Were any study treatments taken?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category of Treatment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXCAT
fields.questionText: What is the category of the study treatment?

fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".

fields.completionInstructions: Record the end date or last date of administration of study treatment using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

fields.implementationNotes: If start date and end date are not expected to be on the same date, the end date is required. If the study design indicates that the start and end date are on the same day, the end date is not required since it can be assigned to be equal to the start date.
fields.label: Exposure End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EXENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: EXENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [intended/actual] [treatment/dose] [end] date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXENTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time, (as complete as possible) when study treatment administration stopped (e.g., for infusions this is the time when the infusion ended).
fields.definition: The end time of treatment represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Recommend collecting the time a medication was ended when a protocol or data collection scenarios requires it. For infusions, the end time of the infusion is typically needed.
fields.label: Exposure End Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EXENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: EXENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [intended/actual] [study treatment/dose] end time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXDSTXT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the dose or amount of study treatment that was administered to/taken by the subject in the period recorded; from the start date/time to the end date/time inclusive.
fields.definition: Dose per administration.
fields.implementationNotes: Dose or amount taken for single administration of study treatment or per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from diary data, drug accountability data, protocol etc.). The data collected in this dose text-format field should be mapped to either SDTMIG variable EXDOSE if numeric or EXDOSTXT if text.
fields.label: Exposure Dose Description
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to EXDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200-400) map to EXDOSTXT in SDTM.
fields.name: EXDSTXT
fields.questionText: What was the dose per administration (of study treatment)?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXDOSU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unit of dose or amount taken per period recorded (e.g., ng, mg, mg/kg).
fields.definition: The unit for intended dose per administration for EXDOSE, EXDOSTOT, or EXDOSTXT.
fields.implementationNotes: Unit of dose or amount taken per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose unit must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from protocol, randomization data). The unit should be pre-printed on the CRF or a field provided on the CRF to capture it. A CDASH Subset Controlled Terminology Codelist Name is available for general dose and volume units.
fields.label: Exposure Dose Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXDOSU
fields.questionText: What was the unit for the dose?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXDOSFRQ

fields.completionInstructions: Record the frequency the study treatment was administered for a defined period of time.
fields.definition: The number of doses given/administered/taken during a specific interval.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources or if there are multiple options. When possible, the options for dose/amount frequency are pre-printed on the CRF. When collected, the recommendation is to collect dosing information in separate fields (e.g., ECDOSE, ECDOSEU, ECDOSFRQ) for specific and consistent data collection and to enable programmatically utilizing these data.
fields.label: Exposure Dosing Frequency per Interval
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXDOSFRQ
fields.questionText: What was the frequency of study treatment dosing?

fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXDOSRGM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXDOSADJ

fields.completionInstructions: Select either Yes or No to indicate whether there was a change in dosing.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not the dose was adjusted.
fields.implementationNotes: Typically, the intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring as it provides a definitive response regarding any dose changes. It provides verification that the associate field on the CRF (EXADJ) was deliberately left blank. However, the sponsor may collect whether the dose was adjusted, without collecting the reason for the change.
fields.label: Dose Adjusted
fields.mappingInstructions: When EXADJ is collected, does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED. When EXADJ is not collected, the sponsor may submit this variable as a SUPPQ.
fields.name: EXDOSADJ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXADJ

fields.completionInstructions: If there was a change in dosing, record the reason for change.
fields.definition: Description or explanation of why a dose of the study treatment is adjusted.
fields.implementationNotes: Captures reason dose was changed or modified. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (for example, adverse event, insufficient response, etc.) or entered as free text. May be used for variations from protocol-specified doses, or changes from expected doses.
fields.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EXADJ
fields.questionText: What was the reason the dose was adjusted (from planned)?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXITRPD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the duration of treatment interruption.
fields.definition: The duration of the treatment interruption as collected.
fields.implementationNotes: In some situations, the duration of the interruption may be calculated from the administration start and end times recorded elsewhere in the CRF.
fields.label: Exposure Interruption Duration
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM = "EXITRP" and SUPPEX.QLABEL="Collected Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected treatment interruption duration and the duration unit components and create EXINTRP using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: EXITRPD
fields.questionText: If the dose was interrupted, how long was the interruption?

fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM = "EXITRP" and SUPPEX.QLABEL="Collected Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected treatment interruption duration and the duration unit components and create EXINTRP using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

fields.questionText: If the dose was interrupted, what were the units for the interruption duration?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EX.EXTPT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point of study treatment administration if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRCSTAT

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the procedure data was not collected.
fields.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site recording a sponsor-defined value (e.g., Not Collected/Not Evaluated/Not Assessed/Not Available/Not Answered)
fields.implementationNotes: A check box used to indicate that data collection was "Not Collected". It cannot be used to indicate that a procedure was not done. This variable may only be populated if PROCCUR is null.
fields.label: Procedure Collected Completion Status
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, the SDTMIG variable PRSTAT is populated by mapping the value of the CDASH variable PRCSTAT "NOT COLLECTED" to "NOT DONE".
fields.name: PRCSTAT
fields.questionText: Was the procedure data collected?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRREASND

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason why the procedure was not done.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (or example, broken equipment, subject refused, etc.) or entered as free text. When PRREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset. The value "NOT DONE" here indicates that the subject was not questioned/data was not collected. It does not mean that the subject did not have the procedure.
fields.label: Procedure Reason Not Done
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRREASND
fields.questionText: What was the reason not done?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRPRIOR

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Check if the procedure was started before the specified point in time.
fields.definition: Indication the procedure occurred prior to [PRSTTPT] or prior to the date in DM.RFSTDTC.
fields.implementationNotes: See section on Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions and the SDTMIG for more information.
fields.label: Prior Procedure
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as PRSTRF or PRSTRTPT. When populating PRSTRF, or PRSTRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field PRPRIOR is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When PRPRIOR refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTM variable PRSTRF should be populated. When PRPRIOR is compared to any other time point, the SDTM variables PRSTRTPT and PRSTTPT should be used. Note: PRSTRTPT must refer to the time point anchor described in PRSTTPT.
fields.name: PRPRIOR
fields.questionText: Was the procedure performed prior to [PRSTTPT]?; Was the procedure performed prior to study start?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRSTDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date the procedure was started or performed using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). Procedures performed during the study are expected to have a complete start date. Prior procedures that are exclusionary should have both a start and end date.
fields.definition: The date or start date of when the procedure started or was performed represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The preferred method is to collect a complete Start Date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only) for procedures started a considerable amount of time prior to the start of study are acceptable.
fields.label: Procedure Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PRSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PRSTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the procedure [start] date ?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRONGO

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Check the box if the procedure has not ended at the time of data collection and the end date should be left blank.
fields.definition: Indication the procedure is ongoing when no end date is provided.
fields.implementationNotes: Completed to indicate that the procedure has not stopped at the time of data collection. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring, since this field provides further confirmation that the End Date was deliberately left blank. Reference section 2.1.3 for more information about collecting relative date/time and see section 4.1.4 of the SDTMIG V. 3.2 for information about mapping relative times.
fields.label: Ongoing Procedure
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as PRENRF or PRENRTPT. When populating PRENRF, if the value of PRONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating PRENRTPT, if the value of PRONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When PRONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTM variable PRENRF should be populated. When PRONGO is used in conjunction with any other time point, the SDTM variables PRENRTPT and PRENTPT should be used. Note: PRENRTPT must refer to a time point anchor described in PRENTPT.
fields.name: PRONGO
fields.questionText: Was the procedure ongoing?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRENDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the end date of the procedure using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the procedure has not ended, leave this field blank and populate PRONGO as "Y".
fields.definition: The end date of the procedure represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The assumption is that sponsors should either have an End Date or will indicate that the procedure was ongoing at the time of collection or at the end of the study. However, in cases where the End Date can be determined from dates collected elsewhere in the CRF it is not necessary to include an End Date in the CRF. For example, if the procedure is started and stopped within the same day, the End Date will be the same as the Start Date.
fields.label: Procedure End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable PRENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PRENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the procedure end date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRINDC

fields.completionInstructions: Record the reason the procedure was performed based on clinical investigator's evaluation. If performed to treat a condition, and a diagnosis was made, the indication should be the diagnosis. If performed to treat a condition, and no diagnosis was made, the indication should be the signs and symptoms. If taken as prophylaxis, report as "Prophylaxis for " and include a description of the condition(s).
fields.definition: The condition, disease, symptom or disorder that the procedure was used to address or investigate (e.g., why the therapy was taken or administered or the procedure performed).
fields.implementationNotes: This additional information is collected on the CRF when the sponsor wants to capture the reason(s) why a procedure was performed. This information can then be used as deemed appropriate for coding, analysis (e.g., in the classification of procedures), for reconciling the procedures performed on a subject with their provided medical history and/or AEs/SAEs as part of the data clean-up and monitoring process, etc.
fields.label: Procedure Indication
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRINDC
fields.questionText: For what indication, was the [PRTRT] performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRAENO

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier of the adverse event for which this procedure was performed.
fields.definition: Identifier for the adverse event that is the indication for this procedure.
fields.implementationNotes: Intent is to establish a link between the adverse event and the procedure performed for the adverse event. PRAENO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the PR dataset and records in the AE dataset. See section 8.2 in the SDTMIG V3.2 for information on RELREC.
fields.label: Related Adverse Event ID
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the Adverse Events domain.
fields.name: PRAENO
fields.questionText: What was the identifier for the adverse event(s) for which the procedure was performed?

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier of the medical history event for which this procedure was performed.
fields.definition: Identifier for the medical history event that is the indication for this procedure.
fields.implementationNotes: Intent is to establish a link between the medical history condition and the procedure undergone for the medical history condition. PRMHNO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the PR dataset and records in the MH dataset. See section 8.2 in the SDTMIG V3.2 for information on RELREC.
fields.label: Related Medical History Event ID
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the Medical History domain.
fields.name: PRMHNO

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRDSTXT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [dose/amount] of [PRTRT] per administered.
fields.definition: The dose/amount administered during the procedure.
fields.implementationNotes: Defining this data collection field as a dose text field allows for flexibility in capturing dose entries as numbers, text or ranges. The data collected in this dose text-format field should be separated or mapped to either SDTMIG PRDOSE if numeric or PRDOSTXT if text.
fields.label: Procedure Dose Description
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to PRDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200-400) map to PRDOSTXT in SDTM.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the Substance Used category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology (e.g., TOBACCO, ALCOHOL, CAFFEINE). Sponsors may require different types of substance use data (e.g., illicit drug use, cigarettes, etc.); the value for category may be pre-printed on the CRF. If a more detailed type of substance appears on the CRF (e.g., CIGARETTES, CIGARS, rather than TOBACCO), SUCAT is TOBACCO and SUTRT is CIGARETTES. If the sponsor does not specify a type of tobacco on the CRF, SUTRT is TOBACCO. If SUCAT is not collected (e.g. it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process.

fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUNCF

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point
Start Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Check the appropriate box to indicate if the subject has ever used/consumed tobacco/alcohol/caffeine, currently consumes tobacco/alcohol/caffeine, or formerly used/consumed tobacco/alcohol/caffeine.
fields.definition: Indication the pre-specified substance was used.
fields.implementationNotes: The three options, NEVER, CURRENT and FORMER are sponsor-defined in relation to the protocol. If the sponsor has specific definitions, these definitions are detailed in the instructions to the site. As this type of response does not correspond exactly to an SDTM variable, CDASH recommends using the CDASHIG variable SUNCF. Sponsor must decide how to populate the appropriate relative timing variables when the SDTM-based datasets are created. For example, If SUNCF = "Never", the value of SUOCCUR will be "N" and all relative timing variables will be null. If the sponsor chooses to populate the relative start references (SUSTRTPT, SUSTRF) the value will be "BEFORE" when SUNCF= "CURRENT" and "FORMER". If the sponsor also chooses to use relative end references (SUENRF, SUENRTPT) , the SUENRTPT value will be "ONGOING" when SUNCF="CURRENT" while the value of SUENRF will be "DURING/AFTER". Note: When using SUSTRTPT and/or SUENRTPT, these must refer to a "time point anchor" such as SCREENING in SUSTTPT/SUENTPT.
fields.label: Never Current Former Usage
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate SUOCCUR and relative timing variables.
fields.name: SUNCF
fields.questionText: Does/Has the subject ever used/consumed [SUTRT/SUCAT]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

If CMAENO or PRAENO is used, this is the identifier to which CMAENO or PRAENO refers. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Adverse Event Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: AESPID
fields.questionText: What is the adverse event identifier?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field AE.AETERM

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reported Term for the Adverse Event

fields.completionInstructions: Record only one diagnosis, sign or symptom per line (e.g., nausea and vomiting should not be recorded in the same entry, but as two separate entries). Using accepted medical terminology, enter the diagnosis (if known); otherwise enter a sign or symptom.
fields.definition: The reported or pre-specified name of the adverse event.
fields.implementationNotes: Can be represented either as an open entry field to capture verbatim terms reported by subjects or could be pre-printed in the situation where solicited AEs of interest are captured. In most cases, the verbatim term (i.e., investigator-reported term) will be coded to a standard medical dictionary such as MedDRA or WHO ART, after the data have been collected on the CRF.
fields.label: Adverse Event Reported Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: AETERM
fields.questionText: What is the adverse event term?
