rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field AE.AEOCCUR

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if [specific adverse event] has occurred/is occurring by checking Yes or No.
fields.definition: An indication whether a pre-specified adverse event or a group of adverse events occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
fields.implementationNotes: The CDASH variable AEOCCUR is used to indicate the occurrence of pre-specified adverse events (e.g., Did the subject have high blood pressure?). AEOCCUR should not be used for spontaneously reported adverse events. The site should be able to indicate that the response was not asked or answered.
fields.label: Adverse Event Occurrence
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Since the SDTM AE domain is intended to hold only Adverse Events that actually happen, all values collected in AEOCCUR for pre-specified AEs should be submitted in a Findings About Adverse Events data set (FAAE) where FAORRES=the value of AEOCCUR where FATESTCD="OCCUR". In addition, where AEOCCUR = "Y", there should be a corresponding record in the AE domain.
fields.name: AEOCCUR
fields.questionText: Did the subject have [pre-specified adverse event/group of adverse events]?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field AE.AEPRESP

fields.definition: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are pre-specified on a CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to Y, or added during the SDTM-based dataset creation, when the adverse event is pre-specified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both pre-specified adverse events as well as free-text events, the value of AEPRESP should be Y for all pre-specified events and null for events reported as free-text. AEPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.
fields.label: Adverse Event Pre-Specified
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field AE.AEONGO

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Check the box if the adverse event has not resolved at the time of data collection; leave the End Date blank.
fields.definition: Indication AE is ongoing when no End Date is provided.
fields.implementationNotes: Completed to indicate that the AE has not resolved at the time of data collection, when no End Date is collected. In some cases the ongoing status may be determined from AE Outcome. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring, since this field provides further confirmation that the End Date was deliberately left blank. Often used as a tick/checkbox.
fields.label: Ongoing Adverse Event
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as AEENRF or AEENRTPT. When populating AEENRF, if the value of AEONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating AEENRTPT, if the value of AEONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When AEONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable AEENRF should be populated. When AEONGO is compared to any other time point, the SDTMIG variables AEENRTPT and AEENTPT should be used. Note: AEENRTPT must refer to a time point anchor described in AEENTPT.
fields.name: AEONGO
fields.questionText: Is the adverse event ongoing?

fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-controlled Terminology. Actions that are related to the device (e.g., Device Removed, Primary Care Physician Notified). See the SDTM Device IG for information on reporting multiple actions, or actions with multiple devices.
fields.label: Actions Taken with Device
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: AEACNDEV
fields.questionText: What action was taken with a device used in the study?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field AE.AEACNOTH

fields.completionInstructions: Record all other action(s) taken resulting from the adverse event that are unrelated to study treatments or other non-study treatments given because of this adverse event.
fields.definition: A description of other action taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of the study treatment.
fields.implementationNotes: This field is usually collected as a free text field. If possible/desired, the sponsor can create controlled terminology (e.g., Treatment Unblinded, Primary Care Physician Notified).
fields.label: Other Actions Taken
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: AEACNOTH
fields.questionText: What other action was taken?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field AE.AEOUT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the appropriate outcome of the event in relation to the subject's status.
fields.definition: A description of the outcome of an event.
fields.implementationNotes: CDISC Controlled Terminology is used to indicate the outcome of the event as it relates to the subject's status. The Outcome controlled terminology includes ICH E2B values.
fields.label: Outcome of Adverse Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: AEOUT
fields.questionText: What is the outcome of this adverse event?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field AE.AEDIS

fields.completionInstructions: Record if the AE caused the subject to discontinue from the study.
fields.definition: An indication whether the event caused the subject to discontinue from the study.
fields.implementationNotes: Since the Action Taken field was defined to only collect the changes made to the study treatment due to the AE, an additional field was created to identify the AE(s) that caused the subject to discontinue from the study. Some sponsors opt to capture this information only on the Subject Disposition CRF while others choose to collect this data on both the Subject Disposition and AE CRFs, so the specific AE term(s) and related data can be identified. If the CRF is designed to link the DS and AE records then RELREC can be used to identify that relationship.
fields.label: Adverse Event Caused Study Discontinuation
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly an SDTMIG variable. May be used to create a RELREC to link the Adverse Event to the Disposition record. See section 8.2 in the SDTMIG V3.2 for information on RELREC. The sponsor could submitted in a SUPPAE dataset as a value of SUPPAE.QVAL where SUPPAE.QNAM = "AEDIS" and SUPPAE.QLABEL="Caused Study Discontinuation", if appropriate. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: AEDIS
fields.questionText: Did the adverse event cause the subject to be discontinued from the study?

fields.label: Related to Non-Study Treatment
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field AE.AERELNST

self.title: Adverse Event Relationship to Non-Study Treatment

fields.completionInstructions: Record the investigator's opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study drug. May be reported as free text. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE.".
fields.definition: Description of the investigator's opinion as to whether the adverse event may have been due to a treatment other than study treatment.
fields.implementationNotes: May be reported as free text (e.g., "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE". If possible/desired, the sponsor can create controlled terminology.
fields.label: Adverse Event Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: AERELNST
fields.questionText: What is the relationship to non-study treatment?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field AE.AESI

fields.completionInstructions: Record the investigator's opinion as to whether the event is an adverse event of special interest by the sponsor.
fields.definition: An adverse event of special interest (serious or non-serious) is one of scientific and medical concern specific to the sponsor's product or program, for which ongoing monitoring and rapid communication by the investigator to the sponsor can be appropriate. Such an event might warrant further investigation in order to characterize and understand it. Depending on the nature of the event, rapid communication by the trial sponsor to other parties (e.g., regulators) might also be warranted.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH field may be used just to trigger other CRF pages, or populate a value in AECAT or AESCAT. If submitted, this information could be submitted in a SUPP--.QVAL dataset where SUPP--.QNAM= "AESI" and SUPP--.QLABEL = "Adverse Event of Special Interest". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.label: Adverse Event of Special Interest
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: AESI
fields.questionText: Is this event of special interest?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field AE.AEPATT

fields.completionInstructions: For each AE, check the pattern of the AE. If a single event, choose single.
fields.definition: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time.
fields.implementationNotes: Used to report the pattern of the AE (e.g., INTERMITTENT, CONTINUOUS, SINGLE EVENT. For cross over trials, it is NOT recommended to capture this field for intermittent AEs. Instead the AE should have corresponding Start and Stop dates to capture when the AE started and stopped.
fields.label: Pattern of Adverse Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: AEPATT
fields.questionText: What is the adverse event pattern?

If CMCENO or PRCENO is used, this is the identifier to which CMCENO or PRCENO refers. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. If a study collects both pre-specified clinical events as well as free-text events, the value of CEPRESP should be Y for all pre-specified events and null for events reported as free-text. rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CELOC

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the anatomical location of the clinical event.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the clinical event.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Clinical Event Location
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: CELOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEONGO

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Check the box if the clinical event has not resolved at the time of data collection; leave the End Date blank.
fields.definition: Indication the clinical event is ongoing when no end date is provided.
fields.implementationNotes: Completed to indicate that the CE has not resolved at the time of data collection, when no End Date is collected. In some cases the ongoing status may be determined from CE Outcome. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring, since this field provides further confirmation that the End Date was deliberately left blank. Often used as a tick/checkbox.
fields.label: Ongoing Clinical Event
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as CEENRF or CEENRTPT. When populating CEENRF, if the value of CEONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating CEENRTPT, if the value of CEONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When CEONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable CEENRF should be populated. When CEONGO is compared to any other time point, the SDTMIG variables CEENRTPT and CEENTPT should be used. Note: CEENRTPT must refer to a time point anchor described in CEENTPT.
fields.name: CEONGO
fields.questionText: Was the [clinical event] ongoing?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEENDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date that the [clinical event] resolved using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the [clinical event] is ongoing, leave the field blank.
fields.definition: The date when the clinical event resolved/ended represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The definition of resolved is sponsor specific. The preferred method is to collect a complete end date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only or month and year only) may be acceptable.
fields.label: Clinical Event End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CEENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [clinical event] end date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field CE.CEENTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the [clinical event] resolved.
fields.definition: The time when the clinical event ended/resolved represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Collecting the time an CE resolved is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event resolved and the study design is such that it is important to know the CE end time with respect to dosing.
fields.label: End Time of Clinical Event
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CEENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [clinical event] end time?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DS.EPOCH

fields.completionInstructions: Check the [epoch, or insert more appropriate wording] for which disposition is being recorded.
fields.definition: Trial epoch (e.g., DOUBLE BLIND, SINGLE BLIND, TREATMENT, SCREENING, RUN IN) for which subject disposition is being collected.
fields.implementationNotes: If disposition events are collected more than once in the study, EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be pre-printed on the CRF as the title of the page; however, some companies have a standard CRF module that includes a pick-list of epochs. See SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH. EPOCH would only be populated for disposition event and not for protocol milestones.
fields.label: Epoch
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EPOCH
fields.questionText: What is the trial period for this disposition event?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DS.DSDECOD

fields.completionInstructions: Document the subject's status at [insert text corresponding to the selected trial epoch]. If the subject discontinued prematurely, record the primary reason for discontinuation.
fields.definition: The standardized terminology of the disposition term that describes whether a subject completed the study or a portion of a study (epoch) or the reason they did not complete.
fields.implementationNotes: DSDECOD can be used as the pre-printed standardized coded list with DSTERM used to capture any "Specify, Other" information, or DSDECOD can be used on its own. For Sponsor- and/or study-specific reasons for discontinuation, it is recommended that these reasons be pre-printed on the CRF, as subcategories of the appropriate standardized DSDECOD item. However, it is recommended to limit the use of sponsor and study-specific reasons in order to promote consistent use of terminology and hence permit the combination of data across multiple sponsors. Either DSTERM or DSDECOD must be on the CRF. Both may be used if DSTERM is use as a Specify, Other field.
fields.label: Disposition Event Dictionary-Derived/Standardized Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". Both DSDECOD and DSTERM must be populated in the SDTM-based datasets. If DSTERM was collected as an "Other, Specify" free text, populate DSTERM with the free text and populate DSDECOD with the sponsor-defined standardized text. If DSDECOD was collected with no free text, populate DSTERM and DSDECOD in the SDTM-based dataset with the DSDECOD value that was collected.
fields.name: DSDECOD
fields.questionText: What was the subject's status?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DS.DSTERM

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reported Term for the Disposition Event

fields.completionInstructions: Document the subject's status at [insert text corresponding to the selected trial epoch]. If the subject discontinued prematurely, record the primary reason for discontinuation. (Or, if used with a DECOD list), if Other is selected from the Status list, provide the verbatim reason.
fields.definition: The verbatim or pre-specified name of the event. The reported or pre-specified name for how a subject completed the study or a portion of a study (epoch) or the reason they did not complete.
fields.implementationNotes: If used with a DECOD list, free text description of the subject's "Other" status. DSTERM is the verbatim term for subject status when Other is selected from the DSDECOD code list. This field would only be used with the Prompt and Completion Instructions provided as an Specify, Other field in conjunction with DSDECOD. DSTERM may be used by itself when no code list is provided for DSDECOD on the CRF. Either DSTERM or DSDECOD must be on the CRF. DSTERM is required in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: Disposition Event Reported Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The SDTMIG variables DSDECOD and DSTERM must be populated in SDTM. If DSTERM was collected as an "Other, Specify" free text, populate the SDTMIG variable DSTERM with the free text and populate DSDECOD with the sponsor-defined standardized text. If DSDECOD was collected with no free text, populate DSTERM and DSDECOD in the SDTM-based dataset with the DSDECOD value that was collected.
fields.name: DSTERM
fields.questionText: What was the subject's status?; If [DSDECOD], specify

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DS.DSSTDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of [protocol milestone/disposition event] as defined in the protocol and/or CRF Completion Instructions using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of the specified protocol milestone (e.g. informed consent, randomization) or disposition event (e.g. study completion or discontinuation) represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: Define in the protocol and/or CRF Completion Instructions the criteria for completion of each protocol milestone or disposition event for which a disposition CRF will be provided. Only collect the date of each protocol milestone or disposition event once. For example, if the date of the last dose is defined to mark the end of the Treatment Phase epoch, and is collected on the Exposure form, then this field would not be collected on the Disposition CRF module. If not collected elsewhere, this field should be collected on the Disposition CRF module.
fields.label: Disposition Event Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DSSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DSSTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [protocol milestone/disposition event/other event name] date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DS.DSSTTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the subject completed the study or portion of the study as defined in the protocol and/or CRF Completion Instructions. If the subject did not complete the study or portion of the study, record the time (as complete as possible) as defined in the protocol and/or CRF Completion Instructions.
fields.definition: The time of the specified protocol milestone (e.g. informed consent, randomization) or disposition event (e.g., study completion or discontinuation represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Define in the protocol and/or CRF Completion Instructions the criteria for completion of each epoch for which a disposition CRF will be provided. Define also the date of completion or discontinuation. Collecting the time of completion or discontinuation is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. Typically, it is not recommended that a time be collected unless the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time of the event. Only collect the time of completion or discontinuation on the disposition CRF module if the same information is not being collected on another CRF module. For example, if the time of the last dose is defined to mark the end of the Treatment Phase epoch, and is collected on the Drug Exposure form, then this field would not be collected on the Disposition CRF module.
fields.label: Start Time of Disposition Event
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DSSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DSSTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [protocol milestone/disposition event/other event name] time?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DS.DTHDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of death
fields.definition: Date of death for any subject who died.
fields.implementationNotes: The CDASH model defines Death Date as a timing variable; this is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the Sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but it is typically populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains, as deemed appropriate by the sponsor (e.g., DS).
fields.label: Date of Death
fields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DTHDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the subject's date of death?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DS.DSUNBLND

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reported Term for the Disposition Event

fields.completionInstructions: Record yes if the subject's treatment assignment was unblinded/unmasked intentionally due to an Adverse Event, or unintentionally for other reasons (such as, an administrative action), during the subject's blinded/masked treatment. Record the primary reason for discontinuation if the unblinding resulted in the subject discontinuing the trial prematurely
fields.definition: An indication the subject's treatment information was revealed to any unauthorized site personnel during the trial.
fields.implementationNotes: There may be multiple rows in the SDTM DS dataset to represent this information; each with the appropriate DSCAT values. One row could indicate the treatment was unblinded using DSCAT="OTHER EVENT" and another row could indicate the status of the subject at the end of their participation in the trial using DSCAT= "DISPOSTION". If DSUNBLND is yes and information was collected about the reason for the unblinding, populate DSCAT with "OTHER EVENT" and the SDTMIG variables DSTERM with the free text and DSDECOD with the sponsor-defined standardized text (e.g., TREATMENT UNBLINDED). If DSUNBLND is yes, and the unblinding also resulted in the subject discontinuing the trial prematurely, populate DSCAT with "DISPOSTION" and use the SDTM IG variables DSTERM and DSDECOD to capture the applicable discontinuation details. If the unblinding occurred due to an Adverse Event, DSTERM contains the text of the Adverse Event, and in the AE domain the SDTMIG variable AEACNOTH "Were any other actions taken in response to this adverse event?" may include text of "Treatment Unblinded". DSUNBLND may also be used to document intentional unblinding at a protocol defined point in the trial.
fields.label: Unblinded
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. If the CDASH field DSUNBLIND = "Y", then the SDTMIG variables DSDECOD and DSTERM = "TREATMENT UNBLINDED" and "DSCAT" = "OTHER EVENT". If DSUNBLIND = "N", then the CRF should be annotated to indicate that this value is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: DSUNBLND
fields.questionText: Was (study) treatment unblinded by the site?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOONGO

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Record the healthcare encounter as ongoing ('Y') if it has not ended at the time of data collection and the end date should be left blank.
fields.definition: Indication that the encounter is ongoing when no end date is provided.
fields.implementationNotes: Completed to indicate that the healthcare encounter has not ended at the time of data collection. It is expected that every reported encounter has either an End Date or the Ongoing field is populated, but not both. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring, since this field provides further confirmation that the End Date was deliberately left blank See section on Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions and the SDTMIG for more information. Often used as a tick/checkbox. See CDASHIG Section on Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions and the SDTMIG for more information.
fields.label: Ongoing Healthcare Encounter
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as HOENRF or HOENRTPT. When populating HOENRF, if the value of HOONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating HOENRTPT, if the value of HOONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When HOONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable HOENRF should be populated. When HOONGO is compared to any other time point, the SDTMIG variables HOENRTPT and HOENTPT should be used. Note: HOENRTPT must refer to a time point anchor described in HOENTPT.
fields.name: HOONGO
fields.questionText: Was the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM] ongoing?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOREAS

self.title: Reason for the Healthcare Encounter Event

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason for the subject's Healthcare Encounters.
fields.definition: Denotes the reason for the healthcare encounter.
fields.implementationNotes: To ensure data quality, it is recommended that the sponsor develop controlled terminology (e.g., LACK OF EFFICACY, ADVERSE EVENT, CHEMOTHERAPY, PHYSICAL THERAPY, INDICATION UNDER STUDY, NOT INDICATION UNDER STUDY). The sponsor may, however choose to collect this as free text or as a combination of preprinted options and free text in the form of, Specify, Other.
fields.label: Reason for the Healthcare Encounter Event
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPHO dataset as the value of SUPPHO_QVAL where SUPPHO.QNAM ="HOREAS" and SUPPHO.QLABEL="Healthcare Encounter Reason". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: HOREAS
fields.questionText: What was the reason for the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM]?

HOAENO can be used in RELREC to identify a relationship between records in HO dataset and records in the AE dataset. Other identifiers needed to create RELREC such as HOMHNO can be created as needed. See section 8.2 in the SDTMIG V3.2 for information on RELREC.
fields.label: Related Adverse Event ID

fields.definition: The reported or pre-specified name of the medical condition or event.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsors should collect all relevant medical conditions or events, as defined in the protocol. It is a best practice for sponsors to collect all relevant history of surgeries or procedures using the associated diagnosis in the MH domain, while reporting relevant surgeries and procedures in the SDTM PR domain. Null for spontaneously reported events. MHPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DA.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date the drug accountability assessments were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Drug Accountability CRF using the date (DADAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DA.DAPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not drug accountability was done performed.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a planned drug accountability assessment was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be implemented on a CRF page level on a visit-by-visit basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: Drug Accountability Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable DASTAT. If DAPERF = "N", the value of DASTAT will be "NOT DONE". If DAPERF = "Y", DASTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., DACAT and DASCAT, DATPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable DATESTCD would be populated as DAALL and an appropriate test name (DATEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: DAPERF
fields.questionText: Was drug accountability performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DA.DACAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the type of treatment dispensed/returned.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. If the protocol allows dispensing different types of treatment (e.g., study medication, rescue medication, run-in medication) the CRF can capture the type of treatment using DACAT. This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If DACAT is not collected (e.g., it is self-evident from the protocol design), it can be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. See SDTMIG V3.2 DA domain for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT.
fields.label: Category of Drug Accountability Assessment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: DACAT
fields.questionText: What was the type of treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DA.DASCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the study treatment dispensed/returned (e.g., Bottle A, Bottle B).
fields.definition: A sub-division of the DACAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. If it is known at the time of data collection, the treatment name may be collected in DASCAT (with appropriate, but different than DACAT, grouping values). See SDTMIG V3.2 DA domain for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT. DASCAT can only be used if there is an DACAT and it must be a subcategorization of DACAT.
fields.label: Subcategory of Drug Accountability Assessment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: DASCAT
fields.questionText: What was the name of the treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DA.DADAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the exact date the study treatment was (dispensed or returned), using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date the study treatment was dispensed or returned represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The date study treatment dispensed/returned should be recorded for each dispensation for a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed.
fields.label: Drug Accountability
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DADAT
fields.questionText: What was the date the drug accountability assessment was performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DA.DAREFID

fields.completionInstructions: Record treatment label identifier.
fields.definition: An internal or external identifier such as treatment label identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier).
fields.implementationNotes: For the SDTM submission dataset, DAREFID should be used to tie together a block of related records and to link dispensed product to returned product. This packaging identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be collected in different ways (e.g., affixing label onto CRF or scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed. In this situation, sponsors may need to use additional identifier variables.
fields.label: Drug Accountability Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: DAREFID
fields.questionText: What was the treatment label identifier?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DA.DATEST

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the drug accountability assessment if not pre-specified on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding (e.g., dispensed, returned).
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Test can be included as the column header. For a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed, drug accountability amounts should be assessed for each dispensation.
fields.label: Name of Accountability Assessment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The SDTMIG variable DATESTCD may be determined from the value collected in the CDASH field DATEST. The SDTMIG variables DATESTCD and DATEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: DATEST
fields.questionText: What was the drug accountability being assessed?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DD.DTHDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of death.
fields.definition: Date of death for any subject who died.
fields.implementationNotes: The CDASH model defines Death Date as a timing variable; this is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the Sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but it is typically populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains, as deemed appropriate by the sponsor (e.g., DS).
fields.label: Date of Death
fields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.

Only records for criteria that are not met appear in the IE SDTMIG domain. IECAT must be populated. fields.implementationNotes: This field is required to appear on the CRF, but may be null if there are no exceptions to the inclusion/exclusion criteria. The CRF should allow multiple exceptions to be recorded. See SDTMIG V3.2 Section 7.5.2 for assumptions regarding protocol versioning. Sponsor may provide a list of inclusion/ exclusion criteria and the unique identifying codes to the site. The list provided should be versioned/updated when the protocol changes and the criteria are changed. Sponsor should use sponsor developed controlled terminology for IETESTCD.

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

If VSPERF= "Y", VSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., VSCAT and VSSCAT, VSTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD would be populated as VSALL and an appropriate test name VSTEST provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.

fields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable FASTAT. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., FACAT and FASCAT, FATPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. If the protocol allows dispensing different types of study treatment (e.g., study medication, rescue medication, run-in medication) the CRF can capture the type of treatment using DACAT. This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If DACAT is not collected (e.g., it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

The packaging identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be used as the DAREFID. The packaging identifier maybe collected in different ways (e.g., affixing label onto CRF or scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed. In this situation, sponsors may need to use additional variables. For a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed, drug accountability amounts should be assessed for each dispensation. For the SDTM submission dataset, DAREFID should be used to tie together a block of related records and to link dispensed product to returned product. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

fields.label: Returned Drug Accountability Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable DASTAT. If DAPERF = "N", the value of DASTAT will be "NOT DONE". rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.DADAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date drug accountability was performed, using this format ( DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date the study treatment was dispensed or returned represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The date study treatment dispensed/returned should be recorded for each dispensation for a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed. A single date may be collected for all the observations when they are performed on the same date. The date of each observation can also be collected using a CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DADAT. The date of the observation may be determined from a collected date of visit and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Drug Accountability Date of Assessment
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DD.Generic.DTHDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of death.
fields.definition: Date of death for any subject who died.
fields.implementationNotes: The CDASH model defines Death Date as a timing variable; this is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the Sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but it is typically populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains, as deemed appropriate by the sponsor (e.g., DS).
fields.label: Date of Death
fields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DTHDAT
fields.questionText: What was the subject's date of death?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DD.Generic.DDCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the death detail category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for Death Details
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: DDCAT
fields.questionText: What is the category of the death detail assessment?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DD.Generic.DDSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the death detail subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the DDCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header DDSCAT can only be used if there is an DDCAT and it must be a subcategorization of DDCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Death Details
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DD.Generic.DDYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the death details are known. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: General prompt question regarding whether or not any death details were available.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification if all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
fields.label: Any Death Detail Results
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: DDYN
fields.questionText: Were any death detail assessments collected?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DD.Generic.DDDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of collection represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A single date may be collected for all death detail assessments when they are collected on the same date. The date of collection of each assessment can also be collected using a CDASH variable [DDTESTCD]_DDDAT. The date of the assessment may be determined from a collected date of visit and in such cases a separate assessment date field is not required.
fields.label: Death Details Date of Collection
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: [DDTESTCD]_DDDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date [DDTESTCD] assessment was collected?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DD.Generic.DDSPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier which can be used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: Since SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Death Details Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: DDSPID
fields.questionText: What was the death detail assessment identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DD.Generic.DDORRES

fields.completionInstructions: Record the death detail response.
fields.definition: Result of the death detail assessment, as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] (e.g., PRCDTH) or [TESTCD]_DDORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the DD test code e.g., PRCDTH_DDORRES. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Death Details Result
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". In addition to the SDTMIG variable DDORRES, create DDTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of DDTEST from DDTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the DDTEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: DDTESTCD_DDORRES
fields.questionText: What was the death detail assessment result?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DD.Generic.DDEVAL

fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the information.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Death Details Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".

fields.questionText: Who provided the death detail assessment information?

fields.label: Visit Name

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field EG.CentralReading.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of the ECG measurements were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the ECG measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the ECG CRF using the date (EGDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field EG.CentralReading.EGPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not ECG or specific ECG test was done.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a planned ECG measurement, test, observation was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be implemented for an entire ECG, or a specific ECG test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: ECG Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable EGSTAT. If the CDASH field EGPERF= "N", the value of EGSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If EGPERF = "Y", EGSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., EGCAT and EGSCAT, EGTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable EGTESTCD would be populated as EGALL and an appropriate test name (EGTEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: EGPERF
fields.questionText: Was the ECG performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field EG.CentralReading.EGREFID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier number assigned.
fields.definition: An internal or external identifier of the ECG (e.g., waveform number).
fields.implementationNotes: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer if this reference ID happens to be available to the site at the time of collection. It can also be used to link the clinical significance assessment to the proper record in the electronic data. (e.g., UUID for external waveform file, session number automatically generated by electronic equipment).
fields.label: EG Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: EGREFID
fields.questionText: What was the (ECG) [reference identifier/accession number]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71151

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field EG.CentralReading.EGMETHOD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the method used to measure ECG.
fields.definition: Method of the test or examination.
fields.implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. One possible condition is the method used to collect or calculate the ECG data. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the method used matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: Method of ECG is provided as part of the electronic data, or Method of ECG is not pertinent to the protocol, or The protocol specifies only one possible method for collecting ECG measurements and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG using the incorrect method.
fields.label: ECG Method
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EGMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method used for the ECG?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71148

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field EG.CentralReading.EGPOS

fields.completionInstructions: Record the position of the subject during the ECG.
fields.definition: The position of the subject during the ECG measurement.
fields.implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the subject's position matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: Position of the Subject is provided as part of the electronic data, or Position of the Subject is not pertinent to the protocol, or The protocol specifies only one possible position and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG with the subject in the wrong position.
fields.label: ECG Position of Subject
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EGPOS
fields.questionText: What was the position of the subject during the ECG measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field EG.CentralReading.EGDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date the ECG was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date the ECG was performed represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.
fields.label: Date of ECG
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: EGDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the ECG?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field EG.CentralReading.EGTPT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time point labels for when the ECG test should be taken, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.
fields.label: ECG Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time point anchors EGTPTREF (text description) and EGRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables EGTPTNUM, EGELTM.
fields.name: EGTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point of the ECG measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field EG.CentralReading.EGTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time the ECG was done (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: Time of ECG represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.
fields.label: Time of ECG
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: EGTIM
fields.questionText: What was the time the ECG was collected?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field EG.CentralReadingIA.EGMETHOD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the method used to measure ECG.
fields.definition: Method of the test or examination.
fields.implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. One possible condition is the method used to collect or calculate the ECG data. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the method used matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: Method of ECG is provided as part of the electronic data, or Method of ECG is not pertinent to the protocol, or The protocol specifies only one possible method for collecting ECG measurements and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG using the incorrect method.
fields.label: ECG Method
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: EGMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method used to measure ECG?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field EG.CentralReadingIA.EGTPT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time point labels for when the ECG test should be taken, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.
fields.label: ECG Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time point anchors EGTPTREF (text description) and EGRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables EGTPTNUM, EGELTM.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field EG.LocalReading.EGPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not ECG or specific ECG test was done.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a planned ECG measurement, test, observation was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be implemented for an entire ECG, or a specific ECG test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: ECG Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable EGSTAT. If the CDASH field EGPERF= "N", the value of EGSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If EGPERF = "Y", EGSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., EGCAT and EGSCAT, EGTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable EGTESTCD would be populated as EGALL and an appropriate test name (EGTEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: EGPERF
fields.questionText: Was the ECG performed?

This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What is the subject identifier?

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model, Table 2.2.4.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.CentralProcessing.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of the laboratory tests were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the laboratory tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the Laboratory CRF using the date (LBDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.CentralProcessing.LBPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not lab specimen was collected or measurement performed.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a planned laboratory measurement, test, observation or specimen was performed/collected.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be implemented for an Lab entire panel, or on a specific lab test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: Lab Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable LBSTAT. If the CDASH variable LBPERF = "N", the value of LBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If LBPERF = "Y", LBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., LBCAT and LBSCAT, LBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD would be populated as LBALL and an appropriate test name (LBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: LBPERF
fields.questionText: Was the sample collected?; Was the lab performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.CentralProcessing.LBDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date when specimen collection was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of specimen collection represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG LBDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.
fields.label: Date of Specimen Collection
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: LBDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the lab specimen collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.CentralProcessing.LBTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: Time of specimen collection represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis or a specimen is collected over an extended time period.
fields.label: Time of Specimen Collection
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: LBTIM
fields.questionText: What was the (start) time of the lab specimen collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.CentralProcessing.LBCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lab test category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBCAT and or LBSCAT should be included if lab status (NOT DONE) is collected for each lab category/subcategory (e.g., HEMATOLOGY, CHEMISTRY, URINALYSIS).
fields.label: Category for Lab Test
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: LBCAT
fields.questionText: What was the name of the lab panel?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.CentralProcessing.LBSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lab test subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the LBCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology (e.g. Electrolytes, Liver Function). This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBSCAT can only be used if there is an LBCAT and it must be a subcategorization of LBCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Lab Test
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: LBSCAT
fields.questionText: What was name of the lab sub-panel?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.CentralProcessing.LBTPT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point labels for the lab test, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Lab Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time point anchors LBTPTREF (text description) and LBRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables LBTPTNUM, LBELTM.
fields.name: LBTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point of the lab?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.CentralProcessing.LBCOND

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether protocol defined testing conditions were met.
fields.definition: Indication whether the testing condition defined in the protocol were met (e.g. Low fat diet).
fields.implementationNotes: This information is collected when the laboratory test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be pre-printed on the CRF. This may not be relevant for all tests.
fields.label: Lab Test Condition Met
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM ="LBCOND" and SUPPLB.LABEL="Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: LBCOND
fields.questionText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.CentralProcessing.LBFAST

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.
fields.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
fields.implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.
fields.label: Lab Fasting Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: LBFAST
fields.questionText: Was the subject fasting?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.CentralProcessing.LBREFID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the specimen or accession number assigned.
fields.definition: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.
fields.implementationNotes: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).
fields.label: Lab Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: LBREFID
fields.questionText: What was the (laboratory test) [reference identifier/accession number]?
