sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Lab Test or Examination Short Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the Lab measurement or finding, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the lab test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Test can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Lab Test or Examination Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in LBTEST. The SDTMIG variables LBTESTCD and LBTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: LBTEST
fields.questionText: What was the lab test name?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of the laboratory tests were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the laboratory tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the Laboratory CRF using the date (LBDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not lab specimen was collected or measurement performed.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a planned laboratory measurement, test, observation or specimen was performed/collected.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be implemented for an entire panel, or on a specific test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: Lab Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable LBSTAT. If the CDASH variable LBPERF = "N", the value of LBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If LBPERF = "Y", LBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., LBCAT and LBSCAT, LBTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD would be populated as LBALL and an appropriate test name (LBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: LBPERF
fields.questionText: Was the lab performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of specimen collection represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG LBDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.
fields.label: Date of Specimen Collection
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: LBDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the lab specimen collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of specimen collection represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis or a specimen is collected over an extended time period.
fields.label: Time of Specimen Collection
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: LBTIM
fields.questionText: What was the (start) time of the lab specimen collection?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lab test category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBCAT and or LBSCAT should be included if lab status (NOT DONE) is collected for each lab category (e.g., HEMATOLOGY, CHEMISTRY, URINALYSIS).
fields.label: Category for Lab Test
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: LBCAT
fields.questionText: What was the name of the lab panel?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lab test subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the LBCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBSCAT can only be used if there is an LBCAT and it must be a subcategorization of LBCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Lab Test
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: LBSCAT
fields.questionText: What was name of the lab sub-panel?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBTPT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point labels for the lab test, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Lab Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time point anchors LBTPTREF (text description) and LBRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables LBTPTNUM, LBELTM.
fields.name: LBTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point of the lab?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field LB.LocalProcessing.LBCOND

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether protocol defined testing conditions were met.
fields.definition: Indication whether the testing condition defined in the protocol were met (e.g., Low fat diet).
fields.implementationNotes: This information is collected when the laboratory test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be pre-printed on the CRF, such as "Did subject meet diet requirements?". This may not be relevant for all tests.
fields.label: Lab Test Condition Met
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM = "LBCOND" and SUPPLB.LABEL="Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: LBCOND
fields.questionText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the Lab measurement or finding, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the lab test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Test can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Lab Test or Examination Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in LBTEST. The SDTMIG variables LBTESTCD and LBTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MISTAT. If MIPERF = "N", the value of MISTAT will be "NOT DONE". In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MITESTCD would be populated as MIALL and an appropriate test name (MITEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.

fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Microscopic Findings Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.FixedTimePoints.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of the PK samples were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the PK samples at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the PK CRF using the date (PCDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection at Fixed Time Points

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.FixedTimePoints.PCPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate that all of the PK samples in this group were collected.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not PK samples were collected.
fields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented at form-level or sample level. These may be all samples of a particular type or all samples taken for some purpose and may need to be identified by the organization of the data on the form. Each sample collected could result in one or more tests performed, so there can be a one-to-one or one-to-many relationship between samples and tests/results.
fields.label: PK Sampling Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT. If PCPERF = "N", the value of PCSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If PCPERF = "Y", PCSTAT should be null. PCTEST and PCTESTCD must reflect what tests were not done. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., PCCAT and PCSCAT, PCTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD would be populated as PCALL and an appropriate test name (PCTEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: PCPERF
fields.questionText: Were PK samples collected?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection at Fixed Time Points

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.FixedTimePoints.PCSTAT

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the specimen was not done.
fields.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
fields.implementationNotes: A Not Done check box, which indicates the test was "NOT DONE". Typically, there would be one check box for each measurement. This field can be useful on individual sample collections to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.
fields.label: PK Sampling Completion Status
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT is populated by mapping the value of the CDASH variable PCSTAT "NOT DONE" to "NOT DONE".
fields.name: PCSTAT
fields.questionText: Indicate if the PK sample was not done.

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection at Fixed Time Points

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.FixedTimePoints.PCREASND

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason why a PK sample was not collected.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (or example, broken equipment, subject refused, etc.) or entered as free text. When PCREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: PK Sampling Reason Not Done
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PCREASND
fields.questionText: What was the reason the PK sample was not collected?

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection at Fixed Time Points

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.FixedTimePoints.PCDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date when PK sample collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If left blank, "PCDATFL" for this specimen must be populated (or "PCPERF" must be flagged to indicate this sample was not collected).
fields.definition: The date of PK sample collection or the start date of PK sample collection over a period of time (protocol-defined time-point range) represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG PCDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.
fields.label: Date of PK Sample Collection
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PCDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the PK sample collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection at Fixed Time Points

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.FixedTimePoints.PCDATFL

fields.completionInstructions: Select when the date of this specimen collection is the same as the date of the previous specimen collected. If left blank, "PCDAT" for this specimen must be populated. (or "PCPERF" must be flagged to indicate this sample was not collected)
fields.definition: Flag indicating that the PK date (or start date) is the same as the previous specimen collection date (or start date).
fields.implementationNotes: When a series of specimen are taken on a single form, this field is tied to the collection date to allow for the flag to be used as a surrogate for the date field. Its selection means that the date of this specimen is the same as the date of the last specimen collected (in the series). This variable may be used when collecting PK data and the use re-entering of dates is more cumbersome than selecting the check box.
fields.label: PK Sampling Date Flag
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: PCDATFL
fields.prompt: Same as Previous (Specimen/Sample Collection End) Date
fields.questionText: Check if the specimen/sample was collected on the same date as the (last/previous specimen/sample) (collected/collection ended)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection at Fixed Time Points

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.FixedTimePoints.PCTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of PK sample collection or start time for a specimen collected over a period of time (protocol-defined time-point range) represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete time is expected. The SDTMIG PCDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.
fields.label: Time of PK Sample Collection
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PCTIM
fields.questionText: What was the time of the PK sample collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection at Fixed Time Points

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.FixedTimePoints.PCTPT

self.title: PK Sampling Planned Time Point Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point labels for the PK sample collection, if not pre-printed on the CRF. Note: Planned time points are often described as relative to the dosing of the study drug.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.
fields.label: PK Sampling Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors PCTPTREF (text description) and PCRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables PCTPTNUM, PCELTM.
fields.name: PCTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point of the PK sample collection?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.FixedTimePoints.PCFAST

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.
fields.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
fields.implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. Some study treatments may have a food effect and it is important to know whether the dose was taken while the subject was fasted.
fields.label: PK Sampling Fasting Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PCFAST
fields.questionText: Was the subject fasting?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.FixedTimePoints.PCCOND

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether protocol defined testing conditions were met.
fields.definition: Indication whether the testing condition defined in the protocol were met (e.g., Low fat diet).
fields.implementationNotes: This information is collected when the test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be pre-printed on the CRF, such as "Did subject meet diet requirements?". This may not be relevant for all tests. Examples of conditions imposed may include: Calorie fast, Fluid fast, High-fat meal, Low-fat meal, or Exercise.
fields.label: PK Sampling Test Condition Met
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPC dataset as the value of SUPPPC.QVAL where SUPPPC.QNAM = "PCCOND" and SUPP.PCLABEL= "Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: PCCOND
fields.questionText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.FixedTimePoints.PCREFID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the specimen or accession number assigned.
fields.definition: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.
fields.implementationNotes: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).
fields.label: PK Sampling Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: PCREFID
fields.questionText: What was the (PK) [reference identifier/accession number]?

fields.completionInstructions: Record the specimen material type, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: The type of specimen used for a PK sample.
fields.implementationNotes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.FixedTimePoints.PCTEST

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the measurement or finding, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the analyte or specimen characteristics used to obtain the PK measurement or finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsors would typically collect tests related to the specimen characteristics on the CRF (e.g., Volume, Ph). Results for tests on an analyte (e.g., Concentration) would typically be populated when the SDTM-based datasets are created. If the analyte test results are collected on the CRF, the test would be the analyte name. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Test can be included as the column header.
fields.label: PK Sampling Test Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PCTEST. The SDTMIG variables PCTESTCD and PCTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: PCTEST
fields.questionText: What was the test name?

fields.definition: The end date of the specimen collection represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of the end of the specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.
fields.label: PK Sample Collection End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PCENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the end date of the specimen collection?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.TimeInterval.PCENTIM

self.title: End Time of PK Sample Collection

fields.completionInstructions: Record end time of collection (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The end time of the specimen collection represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete end time is expected. The SDTMIG variable PCENDTC variable contains the end date/time, when a specimen is collected over time. If there is no end date/time, the SDTMIG variable PCENDTC should be Null.
fields.label: End Time of PK Sample Collection
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PCENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the specimen collection end time?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.TimeInterval.PCTPT

self.title: PK Sampling Planned Time Point Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point labels for the PK sample collection, if not pre-printed on the CRF. Note: Planned time points are often described as relative to the dosing of the study drug.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.
fields.label: PK Sampling Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors PCTPTREF (text description) and PCRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables PCTPTNUM, PCELTM.
fields.name: PCTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point of the PK sample collection?

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.
fields.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
fields.implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. Some study treatments may have a food effect and it is important to know whether the dose was taken while the subject was fasted.
fields.label: PK Sampling Fasting Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PCFAST
fields.questionText: Was the subject fasting?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PC.TimeInterval.PCCOND

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether protocol defined testing conditions were met.
fields.definition: Indication whether the testing condition defined in the protocol were met (e.g., Low fat diet).
fields.implementationNotes: This information is collected when the test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be pre-printed on the CRF, such as "Did subject meet diet requirements?". This may not be relevant for all tests. Examples of conditions imposed may include: Calorie fast, Fluid fast, High-fat meal, Low-fat meal, or Exercise.
fields.label: PK Sampling Test Condition Met
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPC dataset as the value of SUPPPC.QVAL where SUPPPC.QNAM = "PCCOND" and SUPP.PCLABEL= "Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: PCCOND
fields.questionText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the measurement or finding, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the analyte or specimen characteristics used to obtain the PK measurement or finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsors would typically collect tests related to the specimen characteristics on the CRF (e.g., Volume, Ph). Results for tests on an analyte (e.g., Concentration) would typically be populated when the SDTM-based datasets are created. If the analyte test results are collected on the CRF, the test would be the analyte name. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Test can be included as the column header.
fields.label: PK Sampling Test Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PCTEST. The SDTMIG variables PCTESTCD and PCTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of the physical examination can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the physical examination findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included collected on the Physical Examination CRF using the date (PEDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PEPERF

fields.completionInstructions: If physical examination was performed as planned then select Yes, otherwise, select No.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a planned physical examination was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. Used to ask if the physical exam was performed at the overall subject level at the specified time point. If this field is used then the result should only be mapped to PESTAT if the overall examination, at the subject level, was not performed. If the overall examination was performed then the value of PESTAT would be null for each examined body systems and Not Done for any body systems not examined (see PERES).
fields.label: Physical Examination Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable PESTAT. If PEPERF= "N" the value of PESTAT = "NOT DONE". If PEPERF = "Y", then the actual Physical exam results would be reported by body system (see PERES). PECAT, PESCAT, PETEST and PETESTCD must reflect what tests were not done. If used for an entire CRF or other set of multiple tests with PECAT and PESCAT, PETESTCD = PEALL.
fields.name: PEPERF
fields.questionText: Was the physical examination performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PECAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the physical examination category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor defined Controlled Terminology. The CRF can capture the different types of Physical Exams using PECAT (e.g. GENERAL, OPHTHAMOLOGIC, NEUROLOGICAL). This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If PECAT is not collected (e.g. it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process.
fields.label: Category for Physical Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PECAT
fields.questionText: What was category of the physical examination?

fields.completionInstructions: Record the physical examination subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the PECAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. The CRF can capture the different subtypes of Physical Exams categories using PESCAT. This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If PESCAT is not collected (e.g. it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. PESCAT can only be used if there is a PECAT and it must be a subcategorization of PECAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Physical Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".

Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

fields.definition: Name of the body system.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor should pre-populate CRF with all body systems to be examined. The use of a complete list of body systems eliminates the need for an other, specify category as any abnormalities identified should fall under one of the pre-specified categories. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Body System can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Body System Examined
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". The SDTMIG variable PETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PETEST.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PERES

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the overall assessment for each exam category/body system listed.
fields.definition: Overall assessment of examined body system.
fields.implementationNotes: If the examined body system is normal then the value in PEORRES should be "NORMAL". If the body system is not examined, then the value in PEORRES should be Null and the value in PESTAT should be "NOT DONE". If the examined body system is abnormal, then the value of PEORRES should contain the text of the abnormal findings (PEDESC). If the sponsor's data collection system allows for up front recording of the abnormality and status using a single variable then the SDTM variable name PEORRES may be used in place of CDASH variable names PERES and PEDESC. When the SDTM-based datasets are created, PESTRESC is the standardized value for PEORRES and is populated for any record where PEORRES is not null. If the abnormal findings are coded using a dictionary, then PESTRESC should be the dictionary preferred term or if not coded PEORRES.
fields.label: Physical Exam Verbatim Finding
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTMIG variable PEORRES. If PERES = "Normal", populate PEORRES with the value of PERES. If PERES = "Abnormal", populate PEORRES with the value of PEDESC.
fields.name: PERES
fields.questionText: Were the results normal, abnormal or not done?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PE.Traditional.PEDESC

fields.completionInstructions: Record all abnormal findings for the given body system in the space provided.
fields.definition: Text description of any abnormal findings.
fields.implementationNotes: If the examined body system is normal then the value in PEORRES should be "NORMAL". If the body system is not examined, then the value in PEORRES should be Null and the value in PESTAT should be "NOT DONE". If the examined body system is abnormal, then the value of PEORRES should contain the text of the abnormal findings (PEDESC). If the sponsor's data collection system allows for up front recording of the abnormality and status using a single variable then the SDTM variable name PEORRES may be used in place of CDASH variable names PERES and PEDESC.
fields.label: Physical Exam Abnormal Findings
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTMIG variable PEORRES. If PERES = "Normal", populate PEORRES with the value of PERES. If PERES = "Abnormal", populate PEORRES with the value of PEDESC.
fields.name: PEDESC
fields.questionText: If the result was abnormal, what were the findings?

fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of the subject characteristics were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the subject characteristics at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Subject Characteristics CRF using the date (SCDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable SCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SC.Generic.SCCAT

fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SC.Generic.SCSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the subject characteristics subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the SCCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. SCSCAT can only be used if there is an SCCAT and it must be a subcategorization of SCCAT. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Subcategory for Subject Characteristic
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [SCTESTCD]_SCSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the subject characteristics?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SC.Generic.SCPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if subject characteristics information was collected If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not any subject characteristics were collected.
fields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented for all tests collected on the same horizontal record or for each specific test. When the SDTM-based datasets are created, the value of SCPERF would apply to all tests on the same record. Use the CDASH variable [SCTESTCD]_SCPERF when implemented on a specific test basis. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Subject Characteristic Assessment Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable SCSTAT. If [SCTESTCD]_SCPERF = "N", the value of SCSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If [SCTESTCD]_SCPERF = "Y", SCSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., SCCAT and SCSCAT, SCTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable SCTESTCD would be assigned SCALL and an appropriate test name ( SCTEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: [SCTESTCD]_SCPERF
fields.questionText: Were subject characteristics collected for [SCTESTCD]?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if a skin response test as performed. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a skin response test was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: Skin Response Test Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable SRSTAT. If SRPERF = "N", the value of SRSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If SRPERF = "Y", SRSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., SRCAT and SRSCAT, SRTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable SRTESTCD would be populated as SRALL and an appropriate test name SRTEST provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRPERF
fields.questionText: Was a skin response test performed?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field SR.Generic.SRRFTDAT

self.title: Skin Response Date of Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Record date of the [intervention] administration using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of the reference time point represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. If the date of administration is collected on a separate CRF (e.g., VISDAT), then it should not be collected on the Skin Response CRF.
fields.label: Skin Response Date of Reference Time Point
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRRFTDTC using the ISO 8601 format. SDTMIG Time point anchors SRTPTREF (text description) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables SRTPT, SRTPTNUM, SRELTM.
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRRFTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date the [intervention] was administered?

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of the [intervention] administration using this format (hh:mm).
fields.definition: The time of the reference time point represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis of the skin response (e.g., multiple [intervention] administrations). The time of measurement can be determined from a collected time of the visit (VISTIM) and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required.
fields.label: Skin Response Time of Reference Time Point
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRRFTDTC using the ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: [SRTESTCD]_SRRFTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the time the [intervention] was administered?

This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of the Vital Signs measurements were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Vital Signs CRF using the Vital Signs Date (VSDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the vital signs were collected. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not any vital signs were collected.
fields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented for all tests collected on the same horizontal record or for each specific test. When mapped to SDTM, the value of VSPERF would apply to all tests on the same record. Use the CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSPERF when implemented on a specific test basis.
fields.label: Vital Signs Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable VSSTAT. If VSPERF = "N", the value of VSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If VSPERF = "Y", VSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., VSCAT and VSSCAT, VSTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD would be populated as VSALL and an appropriate test name (VSTEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSPERF
fields.questionText: Were [vital signs/[VSTEST] performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of the vital signs measurement represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A single date may be collected for all the vital sign measurements when they are performed on the same date. The date of each measurement can also be collected for each measurement using a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSDAT. The date of the measurements may be determined from a collected date of visit and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required.
fields.label: Vital Signs Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the measurement(s)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of measurement represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: A single collection time (e.g., VSTIM) may be collected for all the measurements when they are performed at the same time. The time of each measurement can also be collected using a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSTIM.
fields.label: Vital Signs Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSTIM
fields.questionText: What was the time of the measurement(s)?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the vital signs category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for Vital Signs
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: VSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the vital signs?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the vital signs subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the VSCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. VSSCAT can only be used if there is a VSCAT and it must be a subcategorization of VSCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Vital Signs
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSGRPID

fields.completionInstructions: Record unique group identifier. Sponsor may insert additional instructions to ensure each record has a unique group identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier used to tie a block of related records in a single domain.
fields.implementationNotes: It can be beneficial to use an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question. This group identifier ties together all the tests collected on the same horizontal record. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Vital Signs Group ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: VSGRPID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSTPT

self.title: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point labels for vital signs, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header. The planned time point of each measurement can also be collected using a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSTPT.
fields.label: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors VSTPTREF (text description) and VSRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables VSTPTNUM, VSELTM.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSTPT
fields.questionText: What is the planned time point for this vital signs measurement?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field VS.Generic.VSSTAT

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the vital signs measurement was not done.
fields.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
fields.implementationNotes: A single "Not Done" can be collected once for all the tests on the same horizontal record using VSSTAT. The value of VSSTAT applies to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, for each test "NOT DONE" may be collected using the CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSSTAT.
fields.label: Vital Signs Completion Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSSTAT
fields.questionText: Indicate if the [VSTEST] measurement was not done

fields.completionInstructions: Record the vital sign results.
fields.definition: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] e.g., SYSBP or [TESTCD]_VSORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the VS test code e.g., SYSBP_VSORRES. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Vital Signs Result
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". In addition to the SDTMIG variable VSORRES, create VSTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of VSTEST from VSTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the VSTEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSORRES
fields.questionText: What was the result of the [VSTEST] measurement?

fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: A single Unit field can be collected once for all measurements collected on the same horizontal record using VSUNIT. The value of VSUNIT applies to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed for each measurement, unit may be collected using the CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSSTAT. Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text.

fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the [VSTEST] measurement?

classes.description:
The SDTMIG includes three types of special-purpose datasets:

* Domain datasets (Demographics (DM), Comments (CO), Subject Elements (SE), and Subject Visits (SV) which contain subject-level data.
* Trial Design Model (TDM) datasets which contain trial-level data.
* Relationship datasets

These datasets are described in SDTMIG Section 2.3. CDASH does not currently contain information on Trial Design Model, or Relationship datasets. CDASH standards are for collection of subject-level data, therefore the collection of Trial Design domains is out of the scope for CDASH. CDASHIG contains information on these Special-Purpose Domains: Demographics (DM), and Comments (CO).

(Source: CDASHIG v2.0, Section 7)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DM.BRTHDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of birth to the level of precision known (e.g., day/month/year, year, month/year, etc.) in this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: A subject's date of birth (with or without the time of birth). The complete Date of Birth is made from the temporal components of Birth Year, Birth Month, Birth Day and Birth Time.
fields.implementationNotes: BRTHDAT is the collected field used for recording the full birth date. The sponsor may choose to database the date of birth as a single variable (BRTHDAT), or as separate variables for each component of the date/time (BRTHYR, BRTHMO, BRTHDY, BRTHTIM). The sponsor may choose a method based on database considerations, or for regulatory reasons. It is expected that what is collected for BRTHDAT (complete date or whichever components are collected) is reported in the SDTMIG variable BRTHDTC in the ISO 8601 format. If data are collected in a manner resulting in a reduced precision level, then the AGE (SDTM expected variable), if not collected on the CRF, should be derived using a documented algorithm that describes how the age was determined and/or imputed for those birth dates collected with reduced precision.
fields.label: Date of Birth
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable BRTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: BRTHDAT
fields.questionText: What is the subject's date of birth?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DM.AGE

fields.completionInstructions: Record age of the subject.
fields.definition: The age of the subject expressed in AGEU.
fields.implementationNotes: If Age is collected, it should be collected as a number and, to be correctly interpreted, the age value should be associated to a variable for the Age Unit. It may be necessary to know when the age was collected as an age may need to be recalculated for analysis, such as deriving age at a reference start time (RFSTDTC for SDTM). BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases (due to subject privacy concerns). If AGE is collected, then it is recommended that the date of collection also be recorded, either separately or by association to the date of the visit.
fields.label: Age
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target"
fields.name: AGE
fields.questionText: What is the subject's age?

fields.implementationNotes: If Age is captured on the CRF, the age unit must be known to make the age value meaningful. The age unit might be collected on the CRF, in those cases where the protocol allows for any age group, or it may be pre-printed on the CRF (typically with the unit of "years").

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DM.ETHNIC

fields.completionInstructions: Study participants should self-report ethnicity, with ethnicity being asked about before race.
fields.definition: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.
fields.implementationNotes: For use when values are being collected using the exact non-extensible ETHNIC codelist (C66790) values. Sponsors should refer to "Collection of Race and Ethnicity Data in Clinical Trials" (FDA, September 2016) for guidance regarding the collection of ethnicity (http://www.fda.gov/ucm/groups/fdagov-public/@fdagov-afda-gen/documents/document/ucm126396.pdf)
fields.label: Ethnicity
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target"
fields.name: ETHNIC
fields.questionText: Do you consider yourself Hispanic/Latino or not Hispanic/Latino?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DM.CETHNIC

fields.completionInstructions: Study participants should self-report ethnicity, with ethnicity being asked about before race.
fields.definition: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.
fields.implementationNotes: Use when values are collected using the NCI Thesaurus codelist for Ethnicity As Collected (C128690), the extended HL7 hierarchy of codelist values, or other Regulatory Agency specific controlled terminology for Ethnic Group. Sponsors may append a suffix to denote multiple collected ethnicities (e.g. CETHNIC1, CETHNIC2).
fields.label: Collected Ethnicity
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPDM dataset as the value of SUPPDM.QVAL where SUPPDM.QNAM = "CETHNIC" and SUPPDM.QLABEL= "Collected Ethnicity". See the SDTMIG Section 5-DM Domain. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: CETHNIC
fields.questionText: What is the ethnicity of the subject?

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DM.RACE

fields.completionInstructions: Study participants should self-report race, with race being asked about after ethnicity.
fields.definition: An arbitrary classification based on physical characteristics; a group of persons related by common descent or heredity (U.S. Center for Disease Control).
fields.implementationNotes: Use RACE when the five designations for race used by the FDA are collected (American Indian or Alaska Native; Asian; Black or African American*; Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander ; White) . *For studies where data are collected outside the US, the recommended categories are the same except for Black instead of Black or African American. If multiple races are collected, an alternate sponsor-defined variable structure would be required. Sponsors may record multiple self-reported races for a subject by appending a suffix to denote multiple collected races (e.g. RACE1, RACE2) and populate RACE with the value MULTIPLE. Sponsors should refer to the "Collection of Race and Ethnicity Data in Clinical Trials" (FDA, September 2016). See the SDTMIG Section 5-DM Domain.
fields.label: Race
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target"
fields.name: RACE
fields.questionText: Which of the following five racial designations best describes you? (More than one choice is acceptable.)

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C128689

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DM.CRACE

fields.completionInstructions: Study participants should self-report race, with race being asked about after ethnicity. (The FDA guidance suggests that individuals be permitted to designate a multiracial identity. Check all that apply at the time of collection).
fields.definition: An arbitrary classification based on physical characteristics; a group of persons related by common descent or heredity (U.S. Center for Disease Control).
fields.implementationNotes: Use CRACE when more detailed race categorizations are desired (e.g. more than the five minimum designations for race used by the FDA). The use of race and vocabulary tables located within Health Level Seven's Reference Information Model Structural Vocabulary Tables is recommended, as they are designed to collapse up to the SDTM variable RACE with CT (e.g., American Indian or Alaska Native Asian; Black or African American*; Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander; White ). *For studies where data are collected outside the US, the recommended categories are the same except for Black instead of Black or African American. If multiple races are collected, an alternate sponsor-defined variable structure would be required. Sponsors may record multiple self-reported races for a subject by appending a suffix to denote multiple collected races (e.g. CRACE1, CRACE2) and populate CRACE with the value MULTIPLE. If sponsors, choice to map the extended Race codelist values to the RACE CT (e.g. Japanese to Asian )- then this mapped variable would be reported using the SDTMIG variable RACE. Sponsors should refer to the "Collection of Race and Ethnicity Data in Clinical Trials" (FDA, September 2016).
fields.label: Collected Race
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPDM dataset as the value of SUPPDM.QVAL when SUPPDM.QNAM = "CRACE" and SUPPDM.QLABEL="Collected Race". See the SDTMIG Section for the DM Domain.
fields.name: CRACE
fields.questionText: Which of the following racial designations best describes you? (More than one choice is acceptable.)

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field DM.RACEOTH

fields.completionInstructions: If none of the pre-printed values for RACE are applicable or if another, unprinted selection should be added to those pre-printed values, record the value in this free text field.
fields.definition: A free-text field to be used when none of the pre-printed values for RACE are applicable or if another, unprinted selection should be added to those pre-printed values.
fields.implementationNotes: When creating the Demographics form, it is suggested that you include the five standard race categories. If you choose, you might include another value of Specify, other with a free text field for extending the list of values. The RACEOTH variable contains the free text added by the site. The value(s) added in the optional variable might or might not "collapse up" into one of the five categories specified by the FDA Guidance. See SDTMIG V3.2 for examples of reporting this implementation.
fields.label: Race Other
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPDM dataset as the value of SUPPDM.QVAL where SUPPDM.QNAM = "RACEOTH" and SUPP.QLABEL="RACE OTHER". See the SDTMIG Section 5-DM Domain. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: RACEOTH
fields.questionText: What was the other race?

classes.label: Special Purpose Domains
classes.name: Special-Purpose

description:
The Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) Model, the CDASH Implementation Guide (CDASHIG), and the CDASHIG Metadata Table define basic standards for the collection of clinical trial data and how to implement the standard for specific case report forms. CDASH establishes a standard way to collect data in a similar way across studies and sponsors, so that data collection formats and structures provide clear traceability of submission data into the Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM), delivering more transparency to regulators and others who conduct data review. The CDASH standard is part of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Technical Road Map, which is designed to realize the vision of a set of beginning-to-end harmonized standards for the representation of data from clinical studies throughout the data lifecycle. The CDASH standard directly supports the production of clinical data collection instruments. Through this support, the standard also contributes to:

* Efficient development of research protocols
* Streamlined processes within medical research
* Development of a corporate library of standardized CRFs
* Use of metadata repositories
* Reporting and regulatory submission
* Data warehouse population
* Data archiving
* Post-marketing studies/safety surveillance

For more information, click on the following link: http://www.cdisc.org/strategies-and-goals.
label: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0
name: CDASHIG v2.0
